name: emmer

a very old type of wheat (= a grain used for making flour): Emmer still grows wild in some places today and is an ancestor of our modern wheat varieties. The Ancient Egyptians used emmer wheat to make their densely-textured bread.
More examplesFewer examplesNew bread types are being developed from older grains such as emmer.Emmer is high in fibre and rich in protein and vitamins.Emmer is closely related to wheat, but is largely grown for animal feed. Wild emmer was first cultivated in the Middle East.
